No legislative assembly, political convention or debate club can function without imposed decorum.  As for what you see as a chosen few, is this not what every city council, county commission, school board and legislature in the county is based on, not to mention the U. S. House of Representatives and U. S. Senate? We live in a republic, not a democracy.
 
 And I note that due the fact that the body has 435 members, the U. S. House of Representatives places a limit not only on the amount of time that can be devoted to any given question, but also on how much time any given member can use to speak on that question.
 
 The unlimited free-for-all that you see as a benefit of an internet discussion I see as a severe restraint on the discussion's effectiveness.
